result.execSummary:
The defendant Maynor Yobani Sarceno Lopez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Maynor Yobani Sarceno Lopez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Maynor Yobani Sarceno Lopez was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
To commence within 60 days.  Court grants huber, out of county service and out of county travel.  Sentences are to be consecutive to each other.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maynor Yobani Sarceno Lopez

attys.name: De Los Santos, Gerardo Antonio, Jr

records.addlTxt: Spoke with Dave in GLSO Dispatch to cancel warrant. 44

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Maynor Yobani Sarceno Lopez
Current: 125 Oak Ave  #2, Redwood City, CA 94061-6423 United States  (Effective: 10-25-2017)
Prior: 183 E John St Apt 11, Markesan, WI 53946
FTP Warrant and Notice of Certification - Tax Intercept mailed to Defendant have been returned via USPS.  Return to Sender.  Not Deliverable as Addressed.  Unable to Forward.
Warrant Letter mailed to Defendant has been returned via USPS.  Return to Sender.  Not Deliverable as Addressed.  Unable to Forward.
from Clerk to Defendant re: Warrant

10:15 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Court orders a warrant stayed, pending payment of $443.00 or a reasonable explanation as to why he can't pay.

Court adjourned at 10:16 a.m.

10:36 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Gerardo De Los Santos.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter sworn.  DA recites agreement - defendant will plea to the OAR charges in 2016CM121, 2016CM147 and 2016CT17 with court costs and jail time, consecutive and all other counts will be dismissed.  Atty De Los Santos concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on ct 1 in 16CT17 as charged, count 1 in 16CM121 as charged and count 2 in 16CM147 as charged.  Court orders all other counts and 2016CT12 be dismissed outright.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty De Los Santos.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:
 2016CT17 (Count 1), 2016CM121 (Count 1), 2016CM147 (Count 2) - EACH

-5 days county jail, to commence within 60 days.  Court grants huber, out of county service and out of county travel.  Consecutive to each other.
-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-DNA Sample

Statement by Atty De Los Santos in regards to the jail sentences.  Statement by the Court.

Court adjourned at 10:47 a.m.

10:33 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Gerardo De Los Santos.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  DA recites agreement - defendant will plea to 1 count of OAR in 3 different cases and the balance of the counts and 2016CT12 will be dismissed and read-in.  Atty De Los Santos concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Interpreter sworn.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 on 2016CT17 and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in; finds the defendant guilty on count 2 on 2016CM147 and orders counts 1, 3 & 4 be dismissed and read-in; finds the defendant guilty on count 1 on 2016CM121 and orders counts 2,3 & 4 be dismissed and read-in and orders 2016CT12 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty De Los Santos.  No statement by the defendant.

Statement by the Court - will not accept the agreement and will allow counsel to discuss and will allow the defendant to withdraw plea if he chooses.  Court sets for Status Hearing on August 23, 2016 at 10:00 a.m.  All cases.

Court adjourned at 10:49 a.m.
Status hearing on August 23, 2016 at 10:00 am.
By Atty Gerardo De Los Santos Jr.
Status hearing on July 26, 2016 at 10:00 am.

8:52 A.M.  Defendant present in court with Atty Gerardo De Los Santos.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty De Los Santos confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty De Los Santos enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond.  Court will set for Status Hearing on July 26, 2016 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:54 a.m.
